housecommons.title: HOUSE OF COMMONS.
housecommons.p: The House met at a Quarter before Three of the Clock, Mr. SPEAKER in the Chair.

section.title: NORTHERN IRELAND (MILK INDUSTRY).

p.member: Mr. D. D. REID (by Private Notice)
p.membercontribution: asked the Home Secretary whether he can make any statement as to the possibility of similar measures being taken in Northern Ireland to those contemplated in the statement of milk policy made by the Minister of Agriculture and Fisheries on 22nd February?

: It is the intention of the Government of Northern Ireland to take measures broadly similar to those contemplated in the statement of milk policy made by my right hon. Friend the Minister of Agriculture and Fisheries on 22nd February. It has now been decided that in the Bill to be introduced in

section.p: this House to give statutory sanction to the financial arrangements involved in these proposals, provision will be made for a sum not exceeding £200,000 this year to assist the milk industry in Northern Ireland.

section.title: NEW MEMBER SWORN.
section.p: Benjamin Walter Gardner, esquire, for the Borough of West Ham (Upton Division).

section.title: BUSINESS OF THE HOUSE.
section.p: Motion made, and Question put, "That the Proceedings on Consideration of the Lords Amendments to the Water Supplies (Exceptional Shortage Orders) Bill he exempted, at this day's Sitting, from the provisions of the Standing Order (Sittings of the House)."—[The Prime Minister.]

tr.td: Sir Frederick Thomson and Sir George Penny.
Mr. John and Mr. D. Graham.

section.title: MESSAGE FROM THE LORDS.
section.p: Registration of Births, Deaths, and Marriages (Scotland) (Amendment) Bill,
Ministry of Health Provisional Order (Blackburn) Bill,
Ministry of Health Provisional Order (Shipley) Bill, without Amendment.
